intro: Pithecellobium comosum, commonly known as the golden shower tree, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a small to medium-sized tree or shrub that typically grows up to 6 meters in height. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. Its leaves are pinnately compound, consisting of multiple small, oval-shaped leaflets. The fruit is a legume pod that contains several edible, sweet, and fleshy seeds.
